p: In stand-alone ocean-only model experiments, the surface flux responses estimated from bulk formulae cannot be damped by atmospheric adjustments. We therefore expect Î» F to be considerably more negative. This would result in much smaller SST biases than those in coupled models even if atmospheric forcing errors were similar. Furthermore, we expect the overly strong ocean-only evaporative response to temperature (without the counteracting known precipitation SST response) to result in a substantially overestimated upwards freshwater flux response to SST biases. These unrealistic feedbacks could at least in part explain the need for sea surface salinity restoring towards observational estimates in ocean-only models.
